title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Rosé (Alentejano)
description: This is a really refreshing style of rosé. Its fruity raspberry and red-currant flavors are shot through with fine acidity and a lively crisp aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Jack's House 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: This solid, well-made wine has pleasant apple and pear flavors, light herbal accents, medium body and a smooth texture.

title: Siegel 2016 Crucero Collection Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)
description: A mix of lemon and melon aromas comes before a lightly oaked medium-bodied palate. Oak-based flavors are more obvious than fruit-related ones, while this has a resiny oaky character on the finish.

title: Graveyard 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated blackberry and blueberry flavors are lifted by hints of fennel and smoke on the nose of this bottling. The first impression on the palate is thick cherry syrup, but a definitive structure and prominent acidity emerge to brighten the experience.

title: Polkura 2016 Aylin Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: This is an improvement over recent vintages, but still a bit vegetal on the nose, with aromas of canned beans or peas blending with citrus notes. A slightly oily mouthfeel frames briny citrus and tarragon flavors.

title: Veramonte 2016 Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Oaky, nutty, slightly oily aromas lead to a regular-feeling palate with resiny weight. Salty, lightly oaked flavors of stone fruits don't change much on a finish with melony flavors and light barrel notes.

title: Viña Maipo 2016 Vitral Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)
description: Slightly oily, gritty aromas display some but not a lot of citrus essence. This is a tightly wound SB with briny lime and tart kiwi flavors. A fresh snappy finish tastes of high-acid citrus fruits.

title: Viñas del Vero 2016 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Light, pleasant apple aromas are about all this neutral Chardonnay is giving. Its mild palate with just enough acidity carries clean and easy melon flavors. A slightly briny note closes out the lean finish.

title: Three Rivers 2016 Cabernet Franc Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Not a lot of rosé comes out of this appellation. Light bronze in color, this wine brings vibrant aromas of flowers, cherry, green pepper and fresh herb. The flavors are light, dry and crisp, almost at times seeming a bit sour.

title: Tommasi 2016 Masseria Surani Helios Negroamaro Rosato (Puglia)
description: This opens with aromas of Spanish broom and wild berry. On the fresh easygoing palate, zesty acidity supports juicy red cherry and black raspberry. A nectarine note gives it a tangy close.

title: Sweet Cheeks 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Maybe released just a little too soon, this cuts off its tart rhubarb and raspberry flavors with stiff hard tannins. They bring the flavors to a quick halt, leaving just an impression of stemmy earth.

title: Noviello 2014 Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas of flowers, purple fruit and baking spice are followed by a vanilla-filled palate, with the tannins showing a touch of astringency. The vanilla barrel influence takes over the show, especially on the finish. It's a shame as there are good things going on underneath.

title: Gamache 2012 Estate Grown Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This aromatically unusual wine, with notes of cocoa and green herb, seems to show some oxidation. The purple fruit and orange-peel flavors are on the lighter side of medium bodied, pulling up on the finish.

title: Gianni Tessari 2016  Soave
description: Aromas of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit lead the nose on this bright straightforward white. It's simple but well made, with flavors of yellow peach and a hint of dried herb alongside crisp acidity.

title: Hauner 2015 Hierà Rosé (Terre Siciliane)
description: Aromas of acacia, mature apple, hazelnut and an unusual balsamic note lead the nose. The palate is already evolved and has lost most of its fruit richness and freshness, offering instead honeyed mineral, toasted nut and a hint of dried citrus peel.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Branco White (Alentejano)
description: There is an attractive spiciness to this clean warm wine. White currants and acidity add to the approachability of a wine that is ready to drink.

title: Junta 2010 Grand Reserve Carmenère (Curicó Valley)
description: Hard aromas of road tar and herbal berry fruits are the definition of gritty. Leafy dry red-fruit flavors are light on ripeness, while this is spicy tasting and drawing on the finish.

title: Corte Moschina 2016 Roncathe  (Soave)
description: Bright and easy drinking, this has delicate aromas of yellow wild flower and a whiff of pear. It's fresh and simple, offering yellow apple and a hint of citrus zest alongside crisp acidity.

title: Curran 2016 Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Contemporary Grenache Blanc expressions lean tight and bright, but this bottling takes an extremely tropical approach, showing honeydew, banana cream and bubblegum on the nose. It's restrained upon first sip before overpowering tropical waves take hold. A well-made wine, it will find fans who crave this flowery style.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Alentejano)
description: This is a rounded smooth wine. It does have a crisp edge of red currants and acidity but the main flavor comes from the ripe red-berry fruits and touch of caramel. Drink the wine now.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada

title: Casca Wines 2016 Bote Branco White (Vinho Verde)
description: There is a crisp spring in this wine— light and bright with great acidity and a touch of sweetness. It has a light prickle on the tongue that adds to the liveliness of this attractive wine.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2016 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Fresh easy notes of pear drop rise from the glass. The very slender palate has lemony freshness but also residual sweetness and a pithy phenolic edge. This is fresh, off dry and just balanced. Drink soon.

title: Cave de Saumur NV La Petite Marquise Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This is a ripe wine, shot through with acidity but also with softer pear and ripe apple flavors. It is tangy, made to be drunk young and fruity with a bright, celebratory aftertaste.

title: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Découverte Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: The nose suggests freshly cut Russet pear peel. The palate, slightly dilute, has a bitter edge and expresses just a little of that ripe pear suggested on the nose. Freshness helps the wine to finish dry. Drink soon while aromas hold.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago Rosé (Lisboa)
description: Perfumed and bright, this is an attractive blend that includes Pinot Noir and Syrah. With its ripe creamy texture and exuberant red fruits, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Granit Riesling (Alsace)
description: Grapefruit spiciness and fruit is promised on the nose. The palate does not quite keep the zesty promise, diluting that freshness a little. But there is enough focus to take this to a dry fresh finish.

title: Château de Seguin 2016 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Crisp and tightly fruity, this wine is bright and suffused with a lively streak of acidity. It dances with fruitiness and just a touch of spice. Drink this wine now.

title: Château Pey la Tour 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Although initially the acidity seems high, the fruit and the texture give the Dourthe wine balance. With a touch of spice, the wine is food friendly and ready to drink.

title: Ascension Cellars 2016 Enchantress White (Paso Robles)
description: Candied apple, cantaloupe, plumeria and bubblegum touches show on the nose of this ripe blend of 39% Marsanne, 38% Roussanne and 23% Grenache Blanc. There are strong tropical notes on the palate, including guava, coconut oil and tuberose flavors.

title: Attems 2016 Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)
description: Delicate scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit lead the nose while the fresh light-bodied palate offers suggestions of yellow peach and apple. It closes crisp and clean.
